text: Psalm 5
A Prayer for Guidance and Protection

For the \add music\add* director; with the flutes. A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 5 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Hear my words, O Yahweh.
Give heed to my sighing.\f + \fr 5:1 \ft Or “murmuring” \f*
Listen to the sound of my pleading,\f + \fr 5:2 \ft Or “cry for help” \f* my king and my God,
for to you I pray.
O Yahweh, in \add the\add* morning you will hear my voice.
In \add the\add* morning I will set forth\f + \fr 5:3 \ft Or “present” \f* \add my case\add* to you and I will watch.\f + \fr 5:3 \ft Or “look expectantly” \f*
For you \add are\add* not a God \add who\add* desires\f + \fr 5:4 \ft Or “takes delight in” \f* wickedness.
Evil cannot dwell with you.
The boastful do not stand before\f + \fr 5:5 \ft Or “in front of” \f* your eyes.
You hate all evildoers.
You destroy speakers of lies.\f + \fr 5:6 \ft Hebrew “lie” \f*
⸤A man of bloodshed⸥\f + \fr 5:6 \ft Literally “a man of bloods” \f* and deceit Yahweh abhors.
⸤But as for me⸥,\f + \fr 5:7 \ft Literally “And I” \f* through the abundance of your steadfast love\f + \fr 5:7 \ft Or “covenant love” \f*
I will enter your house.\f + \fr 5:7 \ft Or “temple” \f*
I will bow down\f + \fr 5:7 \ft Or “I will worship” \f* toward ⸤your holy temple⸥\f + \fr 5:7 \ft Literally “the temple of your holiness” \f* in awe \add of\add* you.
O Yahweh, lead me in your righteousness because of my enemies;
make straight before me your way.
For there is not \add anything\add* reliable in his mouth;
their inner part \add is\add* destruction.\f + \fr 5:9 \ft Hebrew “destructions” \f*
Their throat is an open grave;
\add with\add* their tongue they speak deceit.\f + \fr 5:9 \ft Or “flattery; smooth words” \f*
Treat them as guilty, O God;
let them fall because of their plans.
Because of the abundance of their transgressions cast them out,
for they have rebelled against you.
But let all who take shelter in you rejoice.
Let them ever\f + \fr 5:11 \ft Or “perpetually” \f* sing for joy,
⸤because⸥\f + \fr 5:11 \ft Literally “and” \f* you spread protection over them;
And let those\f + \fr 5:11 \ft Or “So that those” \f* \add who\add* love your name exult in you.
For you bless \add the\add* righteous.
O Yahweh, like a\f + \fr 5:12 \ft Hebrew “the” \f* shield you surround him \add with\add* good favor.
